definition: (Taiwan usage) child in need of help (orphaned, abandoned, abused etc)
erhua variant of 背影[bei4 ying3]

sentences.english: I never even once saw a horse anywhere near the place.
sentences.chinese: 其實我在學校附近連一匹馬的影兒也沒見過。

sentences.english: He used up all your savings and now he's gone.
sentences.chinese: 他用光了你的積蓄，連個人影兒都找不到了。

sentences.english: Man is a mere breath, His days are like a passing shadow.
sentences.chinese: 人好像一口氣，他的年日，如同影兒快快過去。

sentences.english: No Catherine could I discover upstairs, and none below.
sentences.chinese: 樓上哪有凱瑟琳的影兒，樓下也沒有。

sentences.english: I have not seen anything of Smith lately.
sentences.chinese: 近來我連史密斯的影兒都沒見到過。

sentences.english: But the new day begins to flash padt in the sigh.
sentences.chinese: 但是新來的日子的影兒又開始在嘆息裏閃過了。

sentences.english: The engineering is long gone in most PC companies.
sentences.chinese: 在那些電腦公司裏，工程學早就沒影兒了。

sentences.english: Which are a shadow of the things to come, but the body is of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 這些原是要來之事的影兒，那實體卻屬於基督。

sentences.english: Butthe new day begins to flash past in the sigh.
sentences.chinese: 但是新來的日子的影兒又開始在嘆息裏閃過了。

sentences.english: He turned round and saw a shadow flit by.
sentences.chinese: 他一回頭，只見有個黑影兒一晃而過。

definition: lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to force someone to do something
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
